message: “All too often human trafficking is swept under the rug, assumed to be a crime that happens somewhere else to someone else,” Esty said in a prepared statement. “As I learned when a human trafficking ring was arrested in my hometown, anyone can become a victim of human trafficking.”

data.description: Two bills that focus on transportation to crack down on human trafficking have been introduced by U.S. Rep. Elizabeth Esty and a lawmaker from New York, Esty's office said. The two bills introduced…
data.title: Esty bills would crack down on forced labor and sex trafficking
